title: Go Away Dog
description: "I don't like you, dog. I don't like dogs at all."That's what a little boy playing alone outdoors tells a small, playful stray dog. But the dog knows something that the boy doesn'tthat boys and dogs are meant to be togetherand in no time at all the boy who said "Go away, dog" is saying "Come on home, dog" instead.In simple, playful words and pictures, Joan Nodset and Paul Meisel have created a friendly, funny story that no young reader will be able to resist.Originally published over forty years ago, this beloved classic is perfect for beginning readers or for cozy times spent reading together.Joan L. Nodset is the pen name of children's book author Joan Lexau. Ms. Lexau has written numerous books for children, including the I Can Read Books Don't Be My Valentine and The Rooftop Mystery, both illustrated by Syd Hoff, as well as the chapter books Striped Ice Cream and Trouble Will Find You. She lives in Otisville, New York.Paul Meisel's funny and energetic illustrations appear in many children's books. His pictures can be found in the I Can Read Books Wizard and Wart and Wizard and Wart at Sea, both by Janice Lee Smith, and Busy Buzzing Bumblebees and Other Tongue Twisters, by Alvin Schwartz. He lives with his family in Newtown, Connecticut.
author: Joan L. Nodset
